newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia auctions T-bills, bonds Sept 11.
newsitem.headline: Russia auctions T-bills, bonds Sept 11.

text.p: The Russian finance ministry will auction 7.50 trillion roubles of six-month GKO discount Treasury bills and 3.50 trillion roubles in a new tranche of 18-month OFZ interest-bearing government bonds on September 11, the central bank said on Wednesday.
Full details of the new issues follow:
There are no limits on purchases of the bills or bonds by non-residents.

The next coupon date for the OFZ bond is November 27, when the bond will pay quarterly interest of 145,799 roubles, equivalent to an annual rate of 58.48 percent, less accruals of 22,430.62 roubles, the central bank said.
Three tranches of the OFZ bond have been issued so far, and around 2.5 trillion roubles of the bond are outstanding.

On September 11 the central bank will also repay about 6.5 trillion roubles in maturing six-month T-bills (series number 22024), and pay about 820 billion roubles in interest on the two-year OFZ bond (series number 24007) maturing in March 1998.
It is also offering one trillion roubles of one-year OGSZ savings bonds.
